{{lowercase|title=dyne:bolic}} {{Infobox OS |name = dyne:bolic |logo = [[Image:Dynebolic logo bevel.png|180px|dyne:bolic logo]] |screenshot = [[Image:Dynebolic 2-5-2.png|180px|dyne:bolic XFCE User Interface Screenshot]] |caption = Screenshot of dyne:bolic |developer = [[Jaromil]], [http://dyne.org dyne.org] |family = [[Unix-like]] |source_model = [[Free and open source software]] |latest_release_version = 3.0.0 |latest_release_date = September 8, 2011 |working_state = Stable |kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] [[Linux kernel]] |ui = [[GNOME|Gnome2]] |license = [[GNU GPL]] and other [[free and open source software]] licenses |website = [http://www.dynebolic.org/ www.dynebolic.org] }} '''dyne:bolic''' is a [[Live CD]]/DVD based on the [[Linux kernel]] with a focus on [[multimedia]] production,<ref name="Compworld">{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com.au/article/142024/dine_geek_heaven_dyne_bolicii?fp=16&fpid=0|title=Dine in geek heaven with Dyne:bolicII |last= McConnachie |first=Dahna|date=2005-10-25|publisher=Computer World|accessdate=2009-03-16}}</ref><ref name="independent">{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/open-source-websites-all-change-on-the-internet-522183.html|title=Open source websites: All change on the internet|last=Kronschnabl|first=Ana |coauthors=Tomas Rawlings |date=2006-01-09|publisher=The Independent|accessdate=2009-03-16}}</ref> and is distributed with a large assortment of applications for audio and video manipulation. Termed "[[Rastafari movement|Rasta]][[software|soft]]" by its author, dyne:bolic is based entirely on [[free software]], and is recognized by the [[GNU Project]] for this characteristic.<ref>[http://www.gnu.org/distros/free-distros.html GNU project website]</ref>
'''dyne:bolic''' is designed and optimized for old and slower computers, turning them into full media stations: this is why the software in it is often not at the newest version available. But the result for this is that the minimum you need is a [[P5 (microarchitecture)|Pentium1]] or [[AMD K5|K5]] PC with only 64 MB RAM and an IDE CD-ROM, or an [[Xbox]] game console - and if you have more than one, you can easily do clusters.<ref name="dynebolic.org">http://dynebolic.org</ref>
Latest version is 3.0.0, codename [[Munir_Said_Thalib|MUNIR]]<ref>[http://www.dynebolic.org/2011/09/announce-3-0-0/#sec-1_5 dynebolic.org version 3.0.0 announcement, section codename]</ref>, released on September 8, 2011.<ref>[http://www.dynebolic.org/2011/09/announce-3-0-0/ dynebolic.org version 3.0.0 announcement]</ref>
== Live CD/DVD == dyne:bolic is designed from ground up to be used as Live CD/DVD. It does not require installation to a hard drive, and attempts to recognize most devices and peripherals automatically (for example: sound, video, TV, etc.). Its kernel is highly optimized for low latency and high performance, making it suitable for audio and video production.<ref name="dynebolic.org"/>
== System requirements == dyne:bolic is not based on any other existing Live CD/DVD technology. Version 3.x has higher system requirements than older versions of dyne:bolic, and is the first version released as DVD image instead of CD-ROM image.
Basic system requirements for version 1.x and 2.x are relatively low: a PC with a Pentium MMX (i586) class CPU and 64 [[Megabyte|MB]] of RAM is sufficient. Some versions of dyne:bolic can be used on an [[Xbox]] game console (Xbox is not currently supported by v2.0).
== Installation == The user copies the dyne directory from the CD (described in dyne:bolic literature as "Docking") to any suitably formatted partition or drive. This filesystem will be recognised and booted by the CD, or there is the option to install a bootloader or edit an existing one. Booting from floppy disk is also supported. Dyne:bolic can save user settings in a file on a partition (or even user's own [[USB flash drive]]) which can also be encrypted for better privacy (described as "Nesting" in the db literature).
== Multimedia support == dyne:bolic has been shaped by the needs of [[mass media|media]] [[activism|activist]]s, [[artist]]s and creators, to be a practical tool for [[multimedia]] production.<ref name="Sharma_07">{{cite web | title=Dyne:Bolic 2.4.2: A live CD multimedia studio | author=Mayank Sharma | url=http://www.linux.com/feature/61140 | date=2007-04-10 }}</ref> It allows manipulation and [[Broadcasting|broadcast]] of both sound and video with tools to record, edit, encode, and stream. In addition to many multimedia specific programs, dyne:bolic also provides word processors and common desktop computing tools.
The dyne:bolic author and maintainer [[Jaromil]] has also created various multimedia tools included in the distribution: MuSE, HasciiCam, [[FreeJ]], as well as other software functionalities such as the nesting and docking, while co-developer and friend, Smilzo contributed the port for Xbox game consoles.
== Modules == dyne:bolic can be extended by downloading extra modules such as development tools or [[OpenOffice.org]]. The modules are [[SquashFS]] files placed in the <tt>modules</tt> directory of a dock (see above) or a CD and are automatically integrated at boot.
== dyne:bolic 1.x == Version 1.4.1 (using Linux 2.4) is a CD-ROM image, and is provided for [[Xbox]] use. [[Xfce]] is used as the [[Desktop environment|desktop]] interface. There are few things that were present in dyne:bolic line 1.x. It was: * [[openMosix]] - clustering software<ref name="db_1_0_readme">''whenever you boot dyne:bolic on a local network, configuring it or having it configured automatically thru DHCP, the system automatically discovers for other dyne:bolic running on it and joins them in a CLUSTER: which means they SHARE their CPU POWER like a "supercomputer"''</ref> * [[WindowMaker]] as fast and small [[memory footprint|footprint]] [[X window manager]] * [[The_World_Factbook|CIA Factbook]] - local copy * ability to boot on [[Xbox]] game console These features were abandoned in the dyne:bolic 2.x series.
== dyne:bolic 2.x == Version 2.5.2 uses Linux 2.6, and is a CD-ROM image. [[Xfce]] is used as the [[Desktop environment|desktop]] interface.
